name: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4301
Reason: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is pyran, which has a melting point of 106°C. (2) The two methyl groups add approximately +10°C each due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. (3) The thione group introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20°C. (4) The additional functionalities, such as the methyl groups, contribute to the melting point.
